page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content: In Tomintoul there is a church and a chapel. The former is called Kirkmichael Parish Church and the latter St. Michael's Catholic Chapel. The population is evenly divided between the two faiths. Next to St. Michael's Chapel there is an old convent which is now used as a holiday place for nuns and children. The minister of Kirkmichael left to take up another charge in February 1985 and will be replaced this summer. In the village there are 3 graveyards, one for the chapel, one for the church and a new cemetery for both Protestants and Catholics. The church hall is used for Sunday School and as a meeting place for the interdenominational Tomintoul Youth Group.
